sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the Ramsey number R(4,4)?
message_2:
The Ramsey number R(4,4) is the smallest integer N such that any graph with N vertices will contain either a clique of size 4 (a complete subgraph with 4 vertices) or an independent set of size 4 (a set of 4 vertices with no edges between them). 

The exact value of R(4,4) is 18. This means that in any graph with 18 vertices, there will always be either a clique of size 4 or an independent set of size 4.
